summary: Implemented a new target-aware backend actor hook and updated React Query keys for the actor and network graph to include ICP target settings (network + canisterId). Network graph fetching is gated on canisterId validity via validation utilities and React Query `enabled`. However, the diff evidence is insufficient to confirm the required Network Map error-state UX (effective target display + retry) is fully implemented.

missing_requirements.requirement: Improve the Network Map load-failure UX so that when the network graph cannot be fetched due to ICP connectivity/target issues, the UI clearly explains that the canister target is unreachable, shows the effective network + canister ID, and provides a one-click retry that re-runs the fetch after the actor/connection is re-established.
missing_requirements.reason: While `NetworkMapPanel` adds a `handleRetry` function and imports utilities like `getNetworkLabel`, the provided diff snippet is truncated before showing any concrete error UI that (a) displays the effective network label and canister ID, and (b) distinguishes target/connectivity errors from other errors. The acceptance-criteria UI elements are not verifiable from the diff summary evidence.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a backend connectivity/health-check React Query hook (`useBackendHealthCheck`).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by REQ-94 through REQ-97; the BuildRequest focuses on actor recreation, target-aware caching, and Network Map error/validation UX, not a separate health-check hook.
